intro: Knautia dipsacifolia subsp. sixtina, commonly known as the Sixtina knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value and ecological benefits make it a valued addition to native plant gardens.
